CatDescriptText: Cutline of images published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspapers, March 10, 1962, page A13, reads: "Prize-Winning Tables - Winning prizes at the annual Brotherhood Food Festival, sponsored by the Pittsburgh Council of Negro Women, last Saturday, at the Hotel Penn-Sheraton, were the three tables above. First prize wen[t] to the table entered by the Seventh District, Deborah Grand Chapter, Order of the Eastern Star, PHA, which used the theme of "Wheat" in its breads of many lands. Left to right: Mrs. Pearl Vaughn of McDonald, Mrs. Josephine Walker, official representative, and Mrs. Martha Hudson. Second prize went to the table entered by the Indian consul, on exotic foods. Mrs. Shelia Rattan (left) serves Mrs. Genevieve Chaudhuri, while Mrs. Davika Mansukhane looks on. Third prize was won by the Lucy Stone Civic League, whose table used the 'Sealtest Products' theme. The large basket was carved from ice. It was filled with flowers. Mrs. Alberta Mason (left) watches Mrs. Geneva Medley rearrange one of the flowers in the basket. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of three women, left to right: Pearl Vaughn, Josephine Walker, and Martha Hudson, standing behind buffet table with trays of food and sign inscribed "Seventh District Deborah Grand chapter O.E.S Prince Hall Affiliation," gathered for the Pittsburgh Council of Negro Women annual Brotherhood Food Festival in interior of the Penn Sheraton Hotel
